articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Jamaican Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Jamaican Ambassador
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Earle Courtenay Rattray, Jamaican ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, he had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets WHO DG and Jamaican Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets WHO DG and Jamaican Ambassador
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun separately met and had a talk with Margaret Chan, director-general of the World Health Organization, and her party and Earle Courtenay Rattray, new Jamaican ambassador to the DPRK, who paid courtesy calls on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano gave a reception at his embassy Tuesday on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, and Ri Yong Chol, vice-department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The Cuban ambassador, addressing the reception, said that the wise and tested leadership of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il has become a source of strength that enabled the Korean people to emerge victorious in socialist construction and the struggle to achieve the reunification of the country. 
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Il great success in his work to lead the Korean people. 
					
					 Pak Ui Chun in his speech referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has paid deep attention to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations with Cuba. 
					
					 He hoped that the Cuban government and people would register successes in the struggle to defend the revolutionary gains under the leadership of Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz.

articles.title: Gift from "Orchestra of 21st Century"
articles.content:
Gift from "Orchestra of 21st Century"
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Pavel Borisovich Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the orchestra, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pakistani Delegation Here
articles.content:
Pakistani Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Pakistani preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung headed by Advisor to the committee Nisar Ahmed Khuhro, speaker of the Assembly of Sind State, arrived here Tuesday by air.

articles.title: CGS of Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces Praises KPA
articles.content:
CGS of Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces Praises KPA
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Army under the leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il has demonstrated its might as an invincible powerful army, said Vice-Minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces and Chief of their General Staff Alvaro Lopez Miera, before departure from the DPRK after visiting it at the head of the delegation of the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces.
					 The friendly relations between the armies and peoples of the two countries have a long history, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people rendered unreserved support and encouragement to the Cuban people when they were undergoing a trial. 
					
					 The delegation's visit to the DPRK marked an important occasion in putting the friendly and cooperative relations between the Cuban Revolutionary Armed Forces and the KPA and the overall bilateral relations on a higher stage. 
					
					 The fraternal and comradely relations of friendship between the two countries provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung are growing stronger thanks to Raul Castro Ruz and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Cuba and the DPRK are fighting against the common enemy.
					
					 We will make positive efforts to consolidate the traditional relations of friendship and militant fraternity between the two armies.
					
					 Giving his impression of the delegation's visit to the DPRK, he said that the President is the great leader revered not only by the Korean people but by the revolutionary people of the world.
					
					 Our visit to different parts of the DPRK during our stay offered an opportunity to know well about its powerful defence capability, he said, adding that the KPA has the combat capability strong enough to defeat any formidable enemy.

articles.title: On-line Operation Medical Service System Starts
articles.content:
On-line Operation Medical Service System Starts
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The operation of on-line medical service system which was established among Kim Man Yu Hospital and different provincial people's hospitals was kicked off with due ceremony at Kim Man Yu Hospital on April 27. 
					 Present there were Ri Pong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, officials of the said hospital, officials concerned, Margaret Chan, director-general of the World Health Organization, and her party on a visit to the DPRK, Sarveshwar Puri, representative of the World Health Organization, and staff members of its mission here. 
					
					 Ri Pong Hun referred to the fact that the on-line medical service system was established in the DPRK with the cooperation of the WHO and expressed thanks for the WHO efforts. 
					
					 He said that after establishing the service system, the DPRK is possible to promptly and correctly ensure diagnosis and treatment measure for patients through on-line video consultation by computer network between hospitals of the capital and the provincial level. 
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK would positively push ahead the work for increasing the effectiveness of the system under the close cooperation with the WHO in the future, too.
					
					 Margaret Chan noted in her speech that the operation of the system is suited to the reality of the DPRK which has lots of mountainous areas, adding that it is a good idea to expand medical service for people by use of IT.
					
					 The on-line medical service system is very profitable, she said before expressing her will to render positive cooperation in the DPRK government's efforts to develop and expand the existing system.
					
					 The director-general and other members of the WHO expressed deep attention over the successful operation of the on-line medical service system in the DPRK.

articles.title: Maritime Rescue Coordination Center
articles.content:
Maritime Rescue Coordination Center
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Maritime Rescue Coordination Center (RCC) has been established under the Maritime Administration of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The RCC provides services for marine and voyage safety in coastal waters and ocean and contributes to the protection of sea environment.
					
					 The center, fully equipped with modern information and communication facilities for SAR (search and rescue) and LRIT (long-range identification and tracking of ships) suitable to conventions and rules concerning international maritime affairs, traces vessels on the ocean and informs related countries of their position in time to ensure their voyage safety.
					
					 It also quickly copes with an emergency on the part of local and foreign vessels entering ports of Korea or navigating in coastal waters.
					
					 It has a managing board, central monitoring system, sub-centers, coastal radio stations and local network connection with related units.
					
					 It is mostly staffed by experts in satellite communication, radio operation, shipping and oceanography.
					
					 Now the center offers marine security information and other necessary services to ships and shipping companies with the help of international organizations, international service centers and the Cospas-Sarsat System.

articles.title: National Classic Published in Translation
articles.content:
National Classic Published in Translation
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of Kim Il Sung University in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has published a translated version of the national classic "Kyuwonsahwa" in the printed style of writing with annotation and bibliography for the sake of convenience.
					 Recorded in the classic, which was compiled in Chinese characters in March 1675, are the 1 205- year-long history of Tangun Korea through 47 kings, folk views on history, nature and universe and other valuable data.
					
					 It, with the main stress on the history of Ancient Korea, also gives an explanation of the previous era along with opinions of its author.
					
					 Having seen the light as late as the beginning of the 20th century owing to destructive and predatory acts of foreign aggressors, it has been used in the study of history, particularly the history of Ancient Korea.

articles.title: Pyongyang Called City in Park
articles.content:
Pyongyang Called City in Park 
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign visitors to Pyongyang are unanimous in calling it a beautiful city with fresh air and good environment, a city in park.
					The city is thick with foliage and its streets are flanked with flower beds and lawns. 
					
					The streets are also lined with trees of good species, including willow,
					
					apricot, maple and ginkgo trees.
					
					Seen at factories, residential quarters, parks, pleasure grounds and all other places are trees, flower gardens and lawns. 
					
					Moran Hill, Mt. Taesong, Mt. Ryongak and other mounts and hills in the city present picturesque landscapes.
					
					Pyongyang has turned into a well-wooded city under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: US Bellicose Forces' War Outbursts Slammed
articles.content:
US Bellicose Forces' War Outbursts Slammed
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) --The commander of the U.S. forces present in south Korea was reported recently to have blustered that  "the command of the 8th U.S. army would be turned into a command for executing a war," adding that the U.S. forces "would provide security" through their long-term presence in south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					The U.S. outbursts revealing its intention to perpetuate its military presence in south Korea were prompted by its sinister aim to put south Korea under its permanent control in a bid to use it as an advance base for carrying out its strategies to invade the DPRK and the rest of Asia.
					
					 The "security" on the lips of the U.S. means a slogan for igniting the second Korean war and a theory of aggression. It is in pursuance of this scenario that the U.S. imperialists seek to turn the command of the 8th U.S. army into a command for executing a war.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that in case the command of the 8th U.S. army is formally inaugurated as a field command for carrying out a war, the commander of the U.S. forces present in south Korea will exercise the right to command wartime operations for hurling not only huge U.S. army, naval and air forces and marines deployed in the vicinity of the Korean Peninsula but strategic nuclear forces into the Korean war to be provoked by them. 
					
					 This is aimed at ensuring a coordinated operational command over the huge U.S. forces to be hurled into the peninsula in case of "emergency" in a bid to win the war by a blitz. 
					
					It is hypocritical for the U.S. imperialists to talk about "ensuring security" on the peninsula. Neither detente nor peace can be expected on the peninsula as long as the U.S. pursues a war, keeping its forces in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. is tightening its sanctions and increasing its pressure upon the DPRK, raising a hue and cry over any "military threat" from it. This cannot be interpreted otherwise than a deliberate move to strain the DPRK-U.S. relations to an extreme phase of tension and move up the zero hour for a war. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to ponder over the grave consequences to be entailed by its adventurous scenario to start the war.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves for Overseas Expansion Blasted
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Moves for Overseas Expansion Blasted
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries in their diplomatic document made public recently decided to use sentences and maps defining Japan's "dominium" over Tok Islets and marking the islets as part of "its territory" for the textbooks of elementary schools, to say nothing of high schools.  This decision goes to prove that Japan's scenario for overseas expansion has entered the phase of its realization.  
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are far-fetchedly insisting that Tok Islets are part of the "territory of Japan" though it was irrefutably proved and universally recognized that the islets belong to Korea.  In a word, this is prompted by their criminal scenario to stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 It is Japan's ulterior aim to systematically implant the ambition for territorial expansion into the minds of the young Japanese and imbue them with a militaristic view on history and revanchism so that they may play a leading role in reinvading Asia. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are stepping up the moves to convert their country into a military giant while inciting militarism for a purpose of realizing their ambition for overseas expansion.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves to grab other countries' territories and turn their country into a military giant are criminal acts of rendering the regional situation unstable and increasing the danger of a war. These moves are nothing but an adventure designed to put Japan's peace and security at peril. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to stop going reckless, bearing deep in mind that the above-said moves will only precipitate their own self-destruction.

articles.title: Halt to US Nuclear Threat to DPRK Urged
articles.content:
Halt to US Nuclear Threat to DPRK Urged
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Friendship Society Norway-Korea in a statement issued on April 20 denounced the "nuclear posture review" issued by the U.S.
					 The review once again indicated that the U.S. still remains unchanged in its ambition to dominate the world with nuclear weapons, the statement noted. 
					
					  U.S. President Obama, when referring to the non-use of nuclear weapons against the non-nuclear states, blustered that an exception is made for the DPRK, the statement noted, branding his remarks as a provocative act of casting a chill over the atmosphere for resuming the talks as they diametrically run counter to the commitment made by the U.S. in the September 19 joint statement not to attack or invade it with either nuclear or conventional weapons.
					
					 It accused the U.S. of using the DPRK's withdrawal from the NPT as a pretext for justifying its hostile policy towards the latter.
					
					 Referring to the fact that the DPRK has developed its own nuclear technology for defending the country's sovereignty and the dignity of the nation from the increasing nuclear threat of the U.S., thus coming to have access to powerful nuclear deterrent, the statement added that this fact is recognized by the international community, too. 
					
					 Friends of the DPRK in Norway strongly urge the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK, immediately defuse the nuclear threat towards it, build confidence between the DPRK and the U.S. and settle the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, declared the statement.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Commemorated
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Commemorated
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Seminars, lectures, reading sessions, photo exhibitions and news briefings took place in Italy, Ethiopia and Indonesia between April 5 and 12 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy said in a report at a seminar that Kim Il Sung, eternal president of the DPRK, was a peerlessly elder statesman who made an immortal contribution to the human cause of independence with his distinguished leadership.
					
					 The general secretary recalled that the President received a great many political and public figures in his whole lifetime and gave lucid answers to the problems concerning the events that took place in the international arena and political issues, clearly indicating the way to be followed by humankind.
					
					Meanwhile, film shows and photo exhibitions were held in Cuba, Russia, Germany, Finland, Malaysia, Laos, Singapore, South Africa and Nigeria between April 7 and 19 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun, the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the 78th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Displayed in their venues were photos on the revolutionary careers of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and their undying feats.
					
					 Participants in the film shows watched the Korean films "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Korean People's Army, Steel-Strong Ranks".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il ve la comedia ligera "Eco de la montana"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il ve la comedia ligera "Eco de la montana"
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, presencio la comedia ligera "Eco de la montana" creada nuevamente por el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional.
					  Esta pieza muestra la vida feliz y los esfuerzos abnegados de los trabajadores agricolas de una zona montanosa por incrementar la produccion de cereales en pleno acato a la politica agricola del partido y por convertir el campo socialista en un paraiso hermoso y confortable a vivir.
					
					  El Dirigente habia dado a la citada entidad artistica la indicacion de reinterpretar y representar ampliamente esa comedia que ha sido vista y apreciada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  Al cabo de su intensa labor de creacion, los creadores y artistas del Conjunto Dramatico Nacional lograron el exito asombroso de haber creado nuevamente en solo 4 meses esa excelente comedia conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo.
					
					  El Dirigente evaluo altamente los exitos de la funcion y dio agradecimiento a los creadores y artistas mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos hayan creado esa excelente comedia, perfecta en lo ideo-artistico y conveniente al sentido estetico de la epoca del Songun, defendiendo estrictamente en las practicas de creacion la original teoria del drama lograda en el proceso de la revolucion dramatica.
					
					  Instruyo otorgar el "Premio Kim Il Sung" a la obra, que sirve de excelente manual en la educacion ideologica para el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea, y dispenso grandes benevolencias a los creadores y artistas puntualizando que la comedia, que esta en el plano cimero tanto en su valor ideologico como en sus demas componentes descriptivos, deviene otra obra maestra monumental que representa la literatura y el arte de la era del Songun.
					
					A traves del proceso de creacion de esta pieza, el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional, que mantiene y continua el valioso patrimonio y el estilo de creacion de 5 dramas revolucionarios, ha mostrado una vez mas su capacidad de prestigiosa entidad artistica, senalo y agrego que esto es la manifestacion contundente de la gran potencialidad del colectivo de creacion de dramas armado firmemente con la idea y la teoria autoctonas del partido sobre la literatura y el arte. 
					
					Hay que mostrar muchos dramas revolucionarios a nuestros habitantes mediante dinamicas actividades de funcion porque por su alto nivel ideo-artistico conveniente a la demanda y la aspiracion de la nueva epoca, ellos sirven de poderosa arma ideologica para formar a todos los miembros de la sociedad como revolucionarios de tipo jucheano y transformar la sociedad segun la demanda de la idea Juche, apunto. 
					
					Ante el Conjunto Dramatico Nacional se presenta la honrosa e importante tarea de consolidar los exitos y las experiencias logrados en la revolucion de dramas y crear a base de ello numerosos dramas revolucionarios de alto valor ideo-artistico para contribuir al cumplimiento de la causa de transformacion de toda la sociedad segun la idea Juche, dijo y presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la creacion artistica y las funciones del conjunto.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el vicemariscal del EPC Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, y otros miembros directivos del ejercito y las demas instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, los secretarios del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, los jefes de departamento Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Il y Kim Yang Gon y otros cuadros directivos del CC del PTC.
					
					Ademas, estuvieron presentes alli los funcionarios de las ramas de literatura y arte, prensa e informacion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Ri Yong Chol
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Ri Yong Chol
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el dia 26 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de Ri Yong Chol, miembro del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador jamaicano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador jamaicano
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- Earle Courtenay Rattray presento el dia 27 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, las cartas credenciales que le acreditan como embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de Jamaica en Corea.
					Acto seguido, Kim sostuvo conversaciones con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por Dia del Sol
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por Dia del Sol
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- En ocasion del Dia del Sol (15 de abril, cumpleanos del Presidente Kim Il Sung), el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Jose Manuel Galego Montano, ofrecio el dia 27 un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
					  A la recepcion fueron invitados el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun, el ministro coreano de Educacion Kim Yong Jin y el subjefe de departamento del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Ri Yong Chol.
					
					    Al hacer uso de la palabra, el embajador cubano subrayo que la sabia y probada direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Il sirvio de la fuente que permitio al pueblo coreano lograr la victoria en la construccion socialista y la lucha por la reunificacion del pais.
					
					    Deseo al Dirigente Kim Jong Il grandes exitos en su labor para conducir al pueblo coreano.
					
					  Pak Ui Chun, en su discurso se refirio a que el Dirigente presta profunda atencion al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con Cuba.
					
					   Deseo que bajo la direccion de los companeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Raul Castro Ruz, el gobierno y el pueblo de Cuba obtengan grandes exitos en su lucha por defender las conquistas de la revolucion.

articles.title: Alvaro Lopez Miera subraya que el EPC es invincible
articles.content:
Alvaro Lopez Miera subraya que el EPC es invencible 
 Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- El viceministro y jefe del Estado Mayor General de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba, quien presidio la delegacion militar de las FAR de visita en Corea, Alvaro Lopez Miera, dijo que el Ejercito Popular de Corea, que goza de la direccion del Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Il, exalta el aspecto majestuoso del invencible ejercito.
					  Se refirio a que las relaciones de amistad entre los ejercitos y los pueblos de los dos paises tienen larga historia y recordo que cuando el pueblo cubano pasaba pruebas, el pueblo coreano le brindo el apoyo y respaldo desinteresados.
					
					  Senalo que su visita a Corea sirve del importante motivo para llevar a una etapa mas alta las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba y el Ejercito Popular de Corea y los vinculos bilaterales en su conjunto.
					
					  Destaco que las relaciones de amistad fraternal y camaraderil preparadas por el companero Fidel Castro Ruz y el Presidente Kim Il Sung se fortalecen y se desarrollan por el companero Raul Castro Ruz y el Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Apunto que Cuba y Corea luchan contra el enemigo comun e hizo hincapie en que se esforzaran activamente por consolidar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y la fraternidad combativa entre los ejercitos de ambos paises.
					
					  En cuanto a su impresion sobre la visita a Corea, el elogio que el Presidente Kim Il Sung es el gran lider a quien respetan el pueblo coreano y los demas pueblos revolucionarios del mundo.
					
					  Diciendo que pudo saber bien sobre la capacidad de defensa nacional de Corea visitando varios lugares, subrayo que el EPC posee la combatividad capaz de derrotar a cualquier enemigo potente.

articles.title: Acto inaugural de sistema de servicio medico a larga distancia
articles.content:
Acto inaugural de sistema de servicio medico a larga distancia
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en el capitalino Hospital Kim Man Yu la ceremonia inaugural de la operacion del sistema de servicio medico a larga distancia establecido entre este hospital y los otros populares provinciales con la colaboracion de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS).
					Participaron en la ocasion el viceministro de Salud Publica, Ri Pong Hun, los funcionarios del citado hospital y los otros correspondientes.
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes Margaret Chan, directora general de la OMS, y su comitiva, de visita en Corea, el representante Sarveshwar Puri y los otros miembros de la oficina de la OMS en Corea.
					
					En su discurso pronunciado en el acto, Ri destaco que por la colaboracion de la OMS fue establecido dicho sistema en Corea y expreso agradecimiento a los esfueros de la citada orgaaniacion.
					
					Continuo que el establecimiento del sistema de servicio medico posibilito asegurar rapida y exactamente la diagnosis y la cura sobre los enfermos mediante la consulta televisiva a larga distancia por la red de computacion entre los hospitales centrales y provinciales.
					
					  Subrayo la necesidad de mejorar tambien en el futuro la eficacia del citado sistema en estrecha cooperacion con la OMS e impulsar activamente la labor para ampliarlo.
					
					Margaret Chan en su discurso se refirio a que la operacion de ese sistema conviene a la realidad de Corea, donde abundan zonas montanosas, y prosiguio que es una magnifica iniciativa extender el servicio medico a los pueblos usando la IT.
					
					Senalo que es muy util el sistema de servicio medico a larga distancia y expreso su voluntad de colaborar activamente con los esfuerzos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea por desarrollar el sistema ya establecido y ampliarlo.
					
					La directora general y otros miembros de la OMS manifestaron profunda atencion a la operacion exitosa del sistema de servicio medico a larga distancia en la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena a los belicistas norteamericanos
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena a los belicistas norteamericanos
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el comandante de las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea dijo que la "comandancia del octavo ejercito norteamericano se convertiria en la del cumplimiento de la guerra" y anadio que sus tropas "darian la seguridad" mediante su presencia a largo plazo en la Peninsula Coreana.
					  Este dicho parte de la siniestra ambicion de ocupar para siempre el suelo surcoreano para utilizarlo como base avanzada en funcion de su estrategia agresiva contra Corea y el resto de Asia.
					
					  Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 27 y continua:
					
					  La "seguridad", de que habla EE.UU., no pasa de ser una consigna para la segunda guerra coreana y la doctrina de agresion. Para este fin, EE.UU. trata de convertir la comandancia del octavo ejercito en la encargada de cumplir la guerra en el terreno.
					
					  Resulta obvio que cuando suceda esto, el comandante de las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes del Sur de Corea tendra la facultad de comandar las operaciones en el tiempo de guerra, con la cual podra movilizar en la guerra coreana no solo las enormes fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas e infantes de marina ubicados en las periferias de la Peninsula Coreana sino tambien las fuerzas nucleares estrategicas.
					
					  De esta manera, los belicistas norteamericanos intentan terminar la guerra a modo de relampago al coordinar el mando sobre las colosales tropas norteamericanas a ser desplegadas en la Peninsula Coreana en el "tiempo de emergencia". 
					
					  La "garantia de la seguridad" de la Peninsula Coreana, de que habla tanto EE.UU., no pasa de ser una mentira y engano.
					
					  Mientras EE.UU. persiga la guerra usando el territorio surcoreano como su base, no se puede esperar jamas el relajamiento de tension ni la paz.
					
					  EE.UU. endurece la sancion y la presion sobre la RPDC hablando ruidosamente de la supuesta "amenaza militar" proveniente de la segunda con el objetivo de anticipar la hora de provocar la guerra empeorando al maximo las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					  EE.UU. debe reflexionar de las graves consecuencias que emanen de sus aventureras maniobras para provocar la guerra.
